title: Who, Whom, Which, Whose, That, What

questions.question: She has acted in a movie …………….. name I don’t remember.
questions.description: Whose name means the same as ‘the name of which’.

questions.question: The only thing ………………. keeps me awake is tea.
questions.description: 'What' means the things which. It cannot replace that. 'Which' is not common after 'only'.

questions.question: I have got something ………………. belongs to you.
questions.description: After quantifiers like something, anything and everything, we prefer that to which.

questions.question: She married a nice young guy …………….. was her senior at college.
questions.description: The relative pronoun who replaces words like he, she or they.

questions.question: It is a story ……………… will captivate readers of all ages.
questions.description: The relative pronoun which can only refer to things. That can refer to both people and things.

questions.question: The proposal ……………… she put forward was quite interesting.
She is somebody ………………. really can’t stand.
questions.description: When the relative pronoun is the object of the relative clause, it is sometimes left out.

questions.question: She has married someone ……………. I really admire.
questions.description: Who is possible here in an informal style.

questions.question: What is the name of the tall girl ………………. just walked in?
questions.description: In identifying relative clauses, we can use that to refer to people.

questions.question: Is that your car ……………….. is parked outside?
